summary: The document is a certification report from the U.S. House of Representatives' Select Committee on Assassinations, dated March 7, 1979. It outlines payroll expenditures for February 1979, detailing employee job titles, annual salaries, and period earnings. The report categorizes expenditures into clerical, professional, and investigative, with a total of $34,300.01 spent on investigative personnel. G. Robert Blakey, as Chief Counsel and Staff Director, certified the employees' performance and their lack of current congressional relationships.
key_findings: The Select Committee on Assassinations expended $34,300.01 on investigative personnel in February 1979.
G. Robert Blakey was the Chief Counsel and Staff Director at the time.
The committee included various roles such as staff counsel, chief clerk, editorial chief, and researchers.
Salary limits ranged from $1,200.00 to $47,500.00 for the period.
